Member Function Documentation

virtual bool sxsdk::modifier_interface::accepts_disk ( void *  aux = 0  )  const [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Returns whether or not waiting for a create disk drag operation in the Figure window.

accepts_sphere(), accepts_disk(), accepts_rectangle(), and accepts_translation() cannot be used simultaneously. If this function returns true, other functions must return false.

Get the drag result with set_disk().

Reimplemented from sxsdk::plugin_interface.

virtual bool sxsdk::modifier_interface::accepts_rectangle ( void *  aux = 0  )  const [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Returns whether or not waiting for a create rectangle drag operation in the Figure window.

accepts_sphere(), accepts_disk(), accepts_rectangle(), and accepts_translation() cannot be used simultaneously. If this function returns true, other functions must return false.

Get the drag result with set_rectangle

Reimplemented from sxsdk::plugin_interface.

virtual bool sxsdk::modifier_interface::accepts_sphere ( void *  aux = 0  )  const [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Returns whether or not waiting for a create sphere drag operation in the Figure window.

accepts_sphere(), accepts_disk(), accepts_rectangle(), and accepts_translation() cannot be used simultaneously. If this function returns true, other functions must return false.

Get the drag result with set_sphere().

Reimplemented from sxsdk::plugin_interface.

virtual bool sxsdk::modifier_interface::accepts_translation ( void *  aux = 0  )  const [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Returns whether or not waiting for a translation drag operation in the Figure window.

accepts_sphere(), accepts_disk(), accepts_rectangle(), and accepts_translation() cannot be used simultaneously. If this function returns true, other functions must return false.

Overridable.

virtual void sxsdk::modifier_interface::make_wireframe ( sxsdk::shape_class &  shape,
const sxsdk::mat4 &  mat,
int  view,
int  flags,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. This function is called then Shade displays the shape's wireframe. The default behavior is to do nothing, but you can override this function and add your own wireframe display.

If you pass the plugin ID to the argument wireframe_id with sxsdk::shape_class::create_attribute_stream_interface_with_uuid() amd generate the attribute stream, this function is called for that object.

An independent wireframe can be constructed by giving a direct OpenGL command within this function. Because this affects the overall processing speed, it is recommended to only do wireframe drawing in this function. Also, scene modifications are not guaranteed.

Parameters:
shape the target object for drawing
mat the local to world coordinates matrix
view the drawing view (0: Side 1: Front 2: Top 3: Pers)
flags bounding mode or pick mode

Reimplemented from sxsdk::plugin_interface.

virtual bool sxsdk::modifier_interface::modify ( sxsdk::scene_interface *  scene,
void *  aux = 0 
) [pure virtual]

Overridable. Called after the plugin is selected from the menu and the specified dialog is displayed.

Returns true if a change occured in the scene, otherwise returns false.

Parameters:
scene the target scene
virtual bool sxsdk::modifier_interface::pre_modify ( sxsdk::scene_interface *  scene,
void *  aux = 0 
) [inline, virtual]

Overridable. Called immediately after the plugin is selected from the menu, before the specified dialog is displayed and the user operation.

Parameters:
